translated: The One Who Embraces the Secret Mantra🔽

original: chen mo'i sgrub thabs/🔽/rgya gar skad du/_ma ha a nu d+ha ri ni🔽d+ha rgo/_bod skad du/_gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma chen mo'i sgrub thabs/_'phags ma
analyzed: chen mo'i sgrub thabs/ /rgya gar skad du/_ma ha a nu d+ha ri ni d+ha rgo/_bod skad du/_gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma chen mo'i sgrub thabs/_'phags ma
translated: The Great Dhāraṇī🔽of the Dhāraṇī Queen🔽In Sanskrit: Mahānu-dhāriṇī-dhāraṇī🔽In Tibetan: The Great Dhāraṇī of the Dhāraṇī Queen

original: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin
analyzed: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin
translated: Homage to the Noble Dhāraṇī Queen!

original: ma zhal gcig ma/_phyag bzhi ma/_nag mo g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na ji lta bu'i
analyzed: ma zhal gcig ma/_phyag bzhi ma/_nag mo g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na ji lta bu'i
translated: The Dhāraṇī Queen has one face, four arms, and is black.

original: sbyor bas/_rdo rje dang /_mchog sbyin pa'i phyag go/_/g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis
analyzed: sbyor bas/_rdo rje dang /_mchog sbyin pa'i phyag go/_/g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis
translated: In her two right hands she displays a vajra and a boon-granting gesture,🔽and in her two left hands she holds an axe and a noose.

original: na dgra sta dang zhags pa'o/_/hum gi sa bon can mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa/_nyi ma'i gdan dang /_rgyab rten la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon bzhin no/_/
analyzed: na dgra sta dang zhags pa'o/_/hum gi sa bon can mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa/_nyi ma'i gdan dang /_rgyab rten la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon bzhin no/_/
translated: She possesses the seed syllable hūṃ, the crown of Akṣobhya, a sun seat, and a backrest, as before.

original: gsang sngags chen mo rjes su 'dzin ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so//_//
analyzed: gsang sngags chen mo rjes su 'dzin ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so//_//
translated: The sādhana of the Great Dhāraṇī Queen is complete.

original: pan+di ta don yod rdo rje dang /_khams pa lo tsha ba dge slong ba ris
analyzed: pan+di ta don yod rdo rje dang /_khams pa lo tsha ba dge slong ba ris
translated: Pandita Amoghavajra and the Khampa Lotsawa Gelong Bar.🔽
Translated and edited by the paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the Khampa Lotsāwa Gelong Baris.
